text: Question 13 Consider the following quantified statement: v¥xeZ [(x*20) Vv (x2+2x-8>0)] Which one of the alternatives provides a true statement regarding the given statement or its negation? 1. The negation 3x € Z, [(x2 < 0) v (x2 + 2x — 8 < 0)] is not true. 2. x =-3 would be a counterexample to prove that the negation is not true. 3. x =-6 would be a counterexample to prove that the statement is not true. 4. The negation 3x € Z, [(x2 < 0) A (X2 + 2x - 8 < 0)] is true. Answer: Alternative 2
